question: In KRAS-mutant tumors, does combining a PI3K (or PI3K/mTOR) inhibitor with a MEK1/2 inhibitor produce greater antitumor efficacy (e.g., tumor shrinkage or improved survival) than either agent alone? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: However, when NVP-BEZ235 was combined with a mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase (MEK) inhibitor, ARRY-142886, there was marked synergy in shrinking these Kras-mutant cancers.
content.source_2: In vivo evaluations found PI3Kâ€“mTOR inhibitors active in PIK3CA-mutant settings, but adding a MEK inhibitor did not enhance antitumor efficacy in KRAS-mutated lung cancers and was associated with increased toxicity.
content.source_3: Although NVP-BEZ235 suppresses the PI3K/mTOR axis and shows antiproliferative effects in cells with either wild-type or mutant p110-alpha, co-treatment with MEK1/2 inhibitors failed to reduce tumor burden in KRAS-driven xenograft models.
